response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Counting the Number of Islands\", \"description\": \"Given an 8x8 grid, where some cells contain 'W' (water) and others are empty ('.'), write a function `count_islands` that counts the number of islands in the grid.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef count_islands(grid: list[list[str]]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `grid`: An 8x8 grid, where cells contain either 'W' (water) or '.' (empty).\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the number of islands in the grid.\\n\", \"code\": \"def count_islands(grid: list[list[str]]) -> int:\\n    def dfs(i: int, j: int) -> None:\\n        if i < 0 or j < 0 or i >= len(grid) or j >= len(grid[0]):\\n            return\\n        if grid[i][j] == 'W':\\n            return\\n        grid[i][j] = 'W'\\n        dfs(i-1, j)\\n        dfs(i+1, j)\\n        dfs(i, j-1)\\n        dfs(i, j+1)\\n    count = 0\\n    for i in range(len(grid)):\\n        for j in range(len(grid[0])):\\n            if grid[i][j] == '.':\\n                dfs(i, j)\\n                count += 1\\n    return count\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert count_islands([['.', '.', '.', 'W'], ['W', '.', '.', '.'], ['.', '.', '.', 'W'], ['W', 'W', 'W', 'W']]) == 3\", \"assert count_islands([['W', 'W', 'W', 'W'], ['W', 'W', 'W', 'W'], ['W', 'W', 'W', 'W'], ['W', 'W', 'W', 'W']]) == 1\", \"assert count_islands([['.', '.', '.' , '.'], ['.', '.', '.'], ['.', '.', '.'], ['.', '.', '.']]) == 1\", \"assert count_islands([['W', 'W', 'W', 'W'], ['W', '.', '.', '.'], ['.', 'W', 'W', 'W'], ['.', '.', 'W', 'W']]) == 2\"] }"
